pr_title: support Node type change in merge configuration Topics

timeline.bodyText: why is the value null? Why wouldn't this save the new value?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Functionally nodeTypeChanged is same as removed. I'll remove the nodeTypeChanged type
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: without your change, does this test fail with the error that nodes cannot change type?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Yes, since the UpdateBehaviorTree is using Merge not Replace. Without the change, merge will fail. My change basically makes merge has the same behavior as replace when node type changes
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: The what here is only from childChanged so if your child changed doesn't propagate this what type, then this is useless.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need a new type? You were modeling this before as a remove and then an add, so what does this type do differently when it seems that you're just removing it on L77.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Functionally it's the same. Yeah I can remove the nodeTypeChanged type.
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.message:
Support node type change in merge topics

Support node type change in merge topics

timeline.bodyText: Since this branch is removed, the original mergeChild code path will go to line 311-314. Is that the correct behavior? Should mergeChild also remove the previous child (line311)?
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline. it's the leafNode->containerNode change. If not removing then the updated value cannot merge in
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: why? If you're adding an interior node, then we want that event!
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Ok I thought it wrong. Will use createInteriorChild(0
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand why this logic just got so much more complicated than yesterday. Why so many changes to just copy over the watchers list?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Basically this just to remove node without invoking remove event on this node's listener. However we still need to have the 'childRemoved' event fire to parent nodes so that ConfigurationWriter knows this node is removed.
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: I don't think that helps anyone. In pretty much all cases, we subscribe to topics and not a topic (or certainly not a topic which might turn into a topics). So ignoring the remove event doesn't help anything and just makes all this far more complicated.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message: Address comments. Copy subscribers over to new node
